Symptoms: Apple scab typically presents as gray to black scabs on leaves and fruit. In advanced stages
Causes: you may notice a velvety texture on the underside of leaves.
Treatments: The disease is caused by the fungus Venturia inaequalis. It spreads through water splashes during rainfall or irrigation.
column5: Control measures include the use of fungicides specifically designed for apple scab, implementing proper pruning to improve air circulation, and maintaining good sanitation in the orchard. Avoid overhead watering to reduce disease spread.

Symptoms: Common rust is identified by reddish-brown pustules that develop on the leaves
Causes: reducing photosynthesis and overall plant health.
Treatments: The fungus Puccinia sorghi is responsible for common rust. It thrives in warm
column6: Control measures include the application of fungicides specific to common rust, and in some cases, planting resistant corn varieties can help reduce the impact of the disease.
